questions.question: The people ............................... walked in just now seem to be rich.
questions.description: We use who to refer to people.

questions.question: The girl ...................................... answered the phone seemed rather clueless.
questions.description: When the relative pronoun is the subject of the relative clause, we use who to refer to people.

questions.question: Where is the person ........................................ called the police?
questions.description: When the relative pronoun is the subject of the relative clause, we use who to refer to people.

questions.question: I have lost the paper on ...................................... I had written her address.
questions.description: In relative clauses which is used to refer to inanimate objects.

questions.question: She is the woman ...................................... I have always wanted to marry.
questions.description: Here the relative pronoun is the object of the relative clause hence we use whom.

questions.question: The woman .................................... child had gone missing was frantic.
questions.description: In relative clauses whose replaces words like her or his.

questions.question: I know a girl ........................................ father is an artist.
questions.description: In relative clauses whose replaces words like her or his.

questions.question: The man .................................... bag was stolen complained to the police.
Who is that girl ..................................... is sitting beside James?
I talked to a man ......................................... had just returned from an overseas trip.
He ....................................... has nothing to lose has no worries.
The woman ....................................... you can see over there is my cousin.
